content:
Apologies for the confusion earlier. I made an error in the INDEX function arguments. Here's the corrected formula:

`=IFERROR(((((('Flow input'!E8/0.2953)*6894.76)+('Flow input'!E10*248.84)+(AVERAGEIFS(INDEX('Logger input'!$1:$1048576,,MATCH("DELTA_P2",'Logger input'!$1:$1,0)),'Logger input'!$A:$A,">="&'Phase Averages'!C9,'Logger input'!$A:$A,"<="&'Phase Averages'!D9))*248.84))/((AVERAGEIFS(INDEX('Logger input'!$1:$1048576,,MATCH("TNL_TMP",'Logger input'!$1:$1,0)),'Logger input'!$A:$A,">="&'Phase Averages'!C9,'Logger input'!$A:$A,"<="&'Phase Averages'!D9)-32)*5/9+273.15)*8.314*(1+(2/100)))/(12*0.0254)^2*3.14159*60/4)*35.3147, "No data")`

The error was due to the wrong range in the INDEX function's first argument. I've updated the range references to include the entire row and column range, and the formula should now work without any errors.

Please ensure that the Time column is in column A on the 'Logger input' tab. If the Time column is in a different column, you'll need to replace 'Logger input'!$A:$A with the appropriate column reference.
